etymology.description: Pictogram (象形) – a bag of salt.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a tied bag containing salt, which naturally extends to meanings like brine and salt. Similar tied-bundle graphs such as 東 and 束 echo the same visual motif of a bound package.
etymology.simplification: Stroke reduction of 鹵 to the streamlined 卤; internal dots and detailing of the 'salt bag' were removed to create a simpler shape that also serves as the simplified radical.

examples.chinese: 盐湖里含有大量卤水(鹽湖裡含有大量鹵水)。
examples.english: The salt lake contains a large amount of brine.

examples.chinese: 工人从地下抽取卤水，用来制盐(工人從地下抽取鹵水，用來製鹽)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngrén cóng dìxià chōuqǔ lǔshuǐ, yònglái zhì yán.
examples.english: Workers pump up brine from underground to make salt.

examples.chinese: 卤素在化学中指能生成盐的元素(鹵素在化學中指能生成鹽的元素)。
examples.pinyin: Lǔsù zài huàxué zhōng zhǐ néng shēngchéng yán de yuánsù.
examples.english: In chemistry, halogens are elements that can form salts.
